intro: Elaeagnus argentea subsp. euargentea, commonly known as silverleaf buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, followed by red or orange berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen make it a useful plant in ecological restoration projects.
